metadata.title: Plume and CTD Data from the Juan de Fuca Ridge (PMEL Vents)

creators.name: Atmospheric Research (OAR), Pacific Marine Environmental Laboratory (PMEL), Vents Program

metadata.description: Plume studies have been conducted on the Juan de Fuca Ridge each year since the inception of the VENTS program. This includes extensive conductivity-temperature-depth (CTD) mapping using both vertical casts and the "tow-yo" technique, light attenuation measurement, water sampling for chemical analysis using SUAVE.
metadata.notes:
Purpose: Our repeated plume measurements permit the study of the long-term evolution of seafloor venting, as well as the discovery of new vents.

Status: In Progress

Maintenance frequency: Unknown
